column2: MARYLAND DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a yield sign?
column8: Diamond

column2: 2. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 3. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 4. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column8: slow down.

column2: 5. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: U-turns are not allowed.

column2: 6. A steady yellow light means:
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 7. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red lights.

column2: 8. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 9. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 10. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 12. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Warning signs

column2: 13. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 14. A curb painted red means:
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column8: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Do not enter

column2: 16. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 17. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column8: drive in low gear.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column8: The road ends ahead

column2: 19. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
column8: Number of Drinks (NOC).

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column8: Side road ahead

column2: 21. Alcohol:
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 22. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge right.

column2: 23. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

column2: 24. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 25. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
